programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: The body of former vice cop Frank McCallum is found beaten to death in an underpass in Paddington. The murder has all the symptoms of a prostitute killing, but DS Ronnie Brooks and DS Matt Devlin soon realise they have to broaden their search. Their investigation forces them to look deeper into Frank McCallum's life - could his boss, Josh Pritchard, know more about Frank's death than he's letting on..(n)

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: DS Ronnie Brooks and DS Matt Devlin are forced to reopen a contentious murder case, and their investigations threaten to unravel James Steel's prosecution of Luke Slade eight years before. Slade, who has been studying law during his time in prison, is given leave to appeal. When he opts to represent himself in court, the case becomes less of a legal appeal and more of a personal vendetta between Slade and Steel. As Slade begins to get the upper hand in court, it seems as if James's career may be on the line.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Drama series set in the 1950s and adapted from the novels by James Runcie. When Theo Graham confesses to Sidney and Geordie that he attacked and killed his landlord Eric Whittaker, they rush to the boarding house and find the alleged victim alive and well, along with his teenage daughter Joan and her stepmother Vivian. However, Eric is killed in a hit and run just hours later. As Sidney is drawn deeper into the twisted emotional world of the boarding house, just who is Vivian trying to protect?(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Drama series set in the 1950s and adapted from the novels by James Runcie. As the trial of local teen Gary Bell approaches, Sidney and Geordie find themselves at loggerheads regarding his guilt. Meanwhile, Sidney is asked by Reggie Lawson to perform an exorcism at his home and stable yards as he is convinced that the spirit of his dead wife Anna haunts the place. That night, Geordie summons Sidney back - Reggie has hanged himself in the same spot as Anna. Why would Reggie take his own life?(n)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.(n)

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alec is pleased that Tina has won the Brewery's barmaid of the month competition. Vera rows with Steph. Ingram tells Mike he's going to fire him. Ivy finds out about Don's bet.(n)

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tina is adamant she won't receive the award as it's her night off. Vera and Steph have to be separated when Vera stops Des parking outside her house. Ingram tells Mike he doesn't trust him.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: When an ex-army schoolteacher takes his strict discipline too far, Joe races to find a missing gun and a schoolboy bent on revenge. Meanwhile, the villagers prepare for a trip to London, but Oscar's itinerary sparks divisions.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Medical drama series. An innocent case of food poisoning turns out to be something more sinister. Frankie does his utmost to ensure that a little girl injured in a cliff fall can still be the Festival Queen.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: The Emmy nominated reality courtroom series, presided over by outspoken family court judge, Judge Judith Sheindlin, invites viewers into the courtroom to witness hard-hitting and compelling disputes between real litigants. Judge Judy is a show about family court cases, marital dissensions and small claims disputes.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: The Emmy nominated reality courtroom series, presided over by outspoken family court judge, Judge Judith Sheindlin, invites viewers into the courtroom to witness hard-hitting and compelling disputes between real litigants. Judge Judy is a show about family court cases, marital dissensions and small claims disputes.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: The Emmy nominated reality courtroom series, presided over by outspoken family court judge, Judge Judith Sheindlin, invites viewers into the courtroom to witness hard-hitting and compelling disputes between real litigants. Judge Judy is a show about family court cases, marital dissensions and small claims disputes.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Miss Marple
programme.desc: When business magnate Rex Fortescue, his young wife and their maid are found murdered, Miss Marple notices that the circumstances recall the nursery rhyme Sing a Song of Sixpence. It is not long before she discovers that secrets run deep in the Fortescue family, but the significance of the song itself is harder to unravel. Then a scandal looms out of the shadowy past, and Miss Marple begins to wonder if there is any rhyme or reason to the deaths at all.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Medical drama series. Dr Weatherill gets embroiled in an ethical battle when the parents of a dangerously ill newborn oppose treatment. A new face at the Royal sets Mr Harper's heart aflutter. Samantha gets some shocking news.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gangster's accountant is on the run from his underworld bosses. David finds an old jeep with a surprising history.(n)

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ingram is in intensive care after having a heart attack. Alec refuses to give Tina a rise. Vera accuses the Barnes' of pulling her stone cladding off.(n)

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mavis finds a piece of stone cladding in the lounge. The Duckworths celebrate their wedding anniversary. Mike moves his desk onto the shop floor to Ivy's annoyance. Bet wonders who Tina's new boyfriend is.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Miss Marple
programme.desc: On learning that an acquaintance who claimed to have knowledge of several unreported murders in her village has died, Miss Marple visits the village of Wychwood-under-Ashe. She charms her way into village life and befriends Luke Fitzwilliam, a handsome former policeman who is increasingly drawn to a mysterious and beautiful new arrival. When a belligerent local GP and a maid suddenly die soon afterwards, Luke finds himself becoming Miss Marple's confidante and ally in the search for the truth.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gangster's accountant is on the run from his underworld bosses. David finds an old jeep with a surprising history.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Murder mystery series. Crime writer Jessica Fletcher is about to receive a special award at Grenshaw College when she finds the proceedings interrupted by a murder.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Drama series set in a Cheshire village during the Second World War. As war draws closer to home, the women have their own battles to fight. Frances tries to help Pat before it is too late, Alison searches for a way out of her own desperate situation, Miriam hides an important piece of news from Bryn, and as the nation's darkest hour looms, the WI faces its biggest challenge yet.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Drama series adapted from the novels by James Runcie. As Gary Bell waits to discover his fate, Sidney is determined to stand by his side. Geordie and Phil arrest violent wife-beater Eddie Jones when stolen goods are found at his house, but he puts up a fight as he is carted off to the cells. Next morning, Geordie's wife Cathy tells Sidney that Geordie did not come home last night. Sidney hurries to the station, where he finds his friend with his knuckles bruised and Eddie dead on a stretcher.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Drama series set in the 1950s and adapted from the novels by James Runcie. Following the difficult events of the past few weeks, Sidney is drinking like never before and seems to have stopped caring about his responsibilities as a clergyman. Meanwhile, Sam Milburn flees after threats are made against his life, but when evidence of a struggle is found, Sidney fears that the worst may have happened. Can Sidney and Georgie work together to investigate the crime and stop a murder being committed?(n)

programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: Piers travels to Homestead Correctional Institution in Florida to meet Amber Wright, who conspired with a group of friends to murder her ex-boyfriend at the age of 15. An innocent teenage boy was beaten, shot and kneecapped before his corpse was burnt and his remains thrown in a quarry. Was this merely an adolescent spat that spiralled into horrific, impulsive violence, or is the striking young woman who sits before Piers actually a cold-hearted killer?(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Detective drama featuring Agatha Christie's celebrated sleuth Hercule Poirot. With the world on the brink of the Second World War, there is more political turmoil when it appears that the famous Peace Party is in fact a cover for the war-mongering organisation Big Four. This complex investigation reunites Poirot with his old friend Japp, as they investigate a case marked by deception, disappearances and death.(n)

programme.title: Carry on Up the Jungle
programme.desc: Bawdy British comedy. The Carry On regulars set off on an exotic safari and soon find themselves plunging in and out of the wrong tents and thrashing their way through the middle of the jungle in search of a rare bird. En route, the gang encounters headhunters, a mateless, all-female tribe and a sex-crazed gorilla.(n)

programme.title: The Ivy
programme.desc: Exclusive documentary that goes behind the scenes as one of the world's most eminent restaurants undergoes its first major renovation in 25 years. The film follows The Ivy's charismatic director Fernando Peire and executive chef Gary Lee as they oversee every twist and turn on the road to the London institution's re-launch. Featuring interviews with the restaurant's illustrious clientele including Calvin Klein, Dame Joan Collins, Maggi Hambling, Ronald Harwood, Tracey Emin and Julian Fellowes.(n)

programme.desc: The Emmy nominated reality courtroom series, presided over by outspoken family court judge, Judge Judith Sheindlin, invites viewers into the courtroom to witness hard-hitting and compelling disputes between real litigants. Judge Judy is a show about family court cases, marital dissensions and small claims disputes.(n)

programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Murder mystery series. Jessica has to unravel the secrets and threats at the funeral of a friend in Wyoming.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Dagger of the Mind
programme.desc: Columbo heads to London to pay a visit to Scotland Yard, only to become embroiled in the case of a suspicious death during a production of Macbeth.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Miss Marple
programme.desc: Miss Marple is faced with her greatest challenge when she receives instructions from Mr Rafiel - a recently deceased friend - to investigate a possible crime. Miss Marple finds herself on a mystery coach tour with her nephew Raymond West and a number of intriguing passengers.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Miss Marple
programme.desc: Miss Marple arrives at the luxurious Bertram's Hotel but soon discovers that there are dark secrets lurking below the highly polished veneer. When one of the maids is murdered, she tries to learn the truth before the murderer strikes again, but the truth is far more sinister than even she is prepared for.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Miss Marple
programme.desc: Miss Marple is overjoyed to be attending the wedding of her old housemaid, only to find a house full of secrets and a family desperately trying to come to terms with the fact that their brother was sent to the gallows for a murder that he did not commit.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Hastings is staying with the Inglethorpes at Styles St Mary, but when their hostess is found murdered, he sends for his old friend Hercule Poirot.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Detective drama. Lewis and Hathaway investigate the strange murder of a beautiful young Eastern European woman whose death comes straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by Oxford tutor Dorian Crane. Is this the work of a crazed fan, or is there something even more sinister going on? Soon it becomes evident that those close to Crane are in danger, and Lewis and Hathaway begin to suspect that actions in a world of fantasy can have very real consequences.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Crime drama series. When a body drops out of a plane and is discovered in a reservoir, Barnaby and Nelson find that the world of stunt pilots and aviation heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder - or does it date back to a tragic story from the Second World War?(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A murder at an Army base threatens long-held secrets amongst a regiment and a protest at a hair salon exposes growing racial tensions in Oxford.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Detective drama series. There is an unexpected culture shock for Morse and Lewis when the search for an ex-supergrass takes them from the dreaming spires of Oxford to the rough-and-ready outback of Australia.(n)
